data.title: The CIA and Saddam
data.meta_description: What does crazy really mean? Many define it as committing the same actions and expecting a different result. In many ways this is how the U.S. has dealt with the Middle East since the British Empire…
data.text:
King of Iraq Faisal II, 1939.

What does crazy really mean? Many define it as committing the same actions and expecting a different result. In many ways this is how the U.S. has dealt with the Middle East since the British Empire fell beginning the 1940s. A case can be made that Saddam Hussein, the Baath Party and the CIA were all insane to have been drawn together. Each party knew full and well they not only did not trust each other, that they had nearly nothing in common to hold them together. In fact, not only were their perspectives inseparably worlds apart, the likelihood of any cohesion and continued cordial relations were never possible. It is incredible that they worked together in a way few are aware of. Saddam Hussein and his clique within the Baath Party would not have conclusively come to power had they not been assisted.

General Qassim would overthrow the Monarchy, in 1958.

Yet both sides never admitted this, nor was it apparent by 1970. The Baathists had gone their own way, the visible face of the party would be Vice President Saddam Hussein. He would embark on a path which was similar to President Gamal Abel Naser, but Saddam would have the resources of one of the most oil rich…
